step1.sentence: After winning three games in a row, the team was really on a roll and felt unstoppable.

step2.story: Jina had been crushing every presentation at work this month. Her boss kept praising her ideas, and two clients signed new deals because of her proposals. She was definitely on a roll, and she wasn't planning to slow down anytime soon.

step3.story: Marco had always struggled with his small bakery, barely breaking even most months. But everything changed when a food blogger discovered his sourdough and posted a glowing review. Suddenly, orders started flooding in from all over the city. Within weeks, he had to hire two extra bakers just to keep up with demand. Marco was on a roll, and for the first time in years, he felt like his dream was actually working out. He smiled every morning as he unlocked the shop door, grateful for the unexpected turn of fortune.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 직역하면 '굴러가는 상태 위에 있다'는 뜻으로, 무언가가 계속 앞으로 나아가는 모습을 떠올리게 합니다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 연속으로 좋은 결과를 내거나 일이 술술 잘 풀릴 때 사용합니다. '요즘 완전 잘 나가고 있어'라는 느낌으로 쓰입니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 도박에서 주사위를 연속으로 성공적으로 굴리는 것에서 유래했다고 알려져 있습니다. 주사위가 계속 좋은 숫자를 내는 행운의 연속을 의미했습니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 긍정적이고 활기찬 뉘앙스를 가지며, 일상 대화에서 가볍게 쓸 수 있는 표현입니다. 격식 없는 상황에서 주로 사용됩니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: I've finished five chapters today — I'm on a roll!
meaning.shortExampleKo: 오늘 다섯 챕터나 끝냈어 — 완전 잘 나가고 있어!
